Virtual Piano

Real-time Piano: Hold keys down to sustain notes, release to stop. Click keys with mouse or use your keyboard. White keys: Q-P, Z-M, and number row. Black keys: 2,3,5,6,7 for first octave.

üéµ Piano Song Collection üéµ

Key Reference (C4 octave starting from Q):

White Keys: Q = C | W = D | E = E | R = F | T = G | Y = A | U = B

Next Octave: I = C5 | O = D5 | P = E5 | [ = E5 | ] = F5

Black Keys: 2 = C# | 3 = D# | 5 = F# | 6 = G# | 7 = A#

Note: ~ = play quickly/short | Letter twice (QQ) = hold longer | | = pause

1. üéÇ Happy Birthday

Part 1 - Happy Birthday to You

Q Q | W~ Q | R~ E~

Happy Birthday to You

Q Q | W~ Q | T~ R~

Happy Birthday to You

Q Q | I~ Y R~ | E W~~

Happy Birthday Dear (name)

7 7 | Y~ R | T R~

Happy Birthday to You

2. ‚≠ê Twinkle Twinkle Little Star

Q Q I I | O O I~ | T T O | Y Y T~ | Q Q I I | O O I~

Twinkle, twinkle, little star, How I wonder what you are

T T O | Y Y T~ | I I O O | T T Y~

Up above the world so high, Like a diamond in the sky

Q Q I I | O O I~ | T T O | Y Y T~

Twinkle, twinkle, little star, How I wonder what you are

3. üîî Jingle Bells

T T T~ | T T T~ | T I Y T | R W E~

Jingle bells, jingle bells, jingle all the way

Y Y Y Y~ | Y T T T | T W W T R W~

Oh what fun it is to ride in a one-horse open sleigh

I I I~ | I I I~ | I O Y T | R W E~

Jingle bells, jingle bells, jingle all the way

Y Y I Y T R | T~

Oh what fun it is to ride!

4. üêë Mary Had a Little Lamb

E W Q W | E E E~ | W W W~ | E I I~

Mary had a little lamb, little lamb, little lamb

E W Q W | E E E | W W E W Q~

Mary had a little lamb, its fleece was white as snow

5. üî§ ABC Song (Alphabet Song)

Q R T | T R | T~ | T T Y~

A B C D E F G

Y Y T R | R~ | T T Y Y T~

H I J K L M N O P

T Y U | U Y | T R | Q~

Q R S T U V

T Y U | U Y | T R | Q~

W X Y and Z

I I Y | T R | Q~

Now I know my ABCs

6. üöú Old MacDonald Had a Farm

Q Q Q | T T T~ | I I T | Y Y T~

Old MacDonald had a farm, E-I-E-I-O

Q Q Q | T T T~ | T Y T R Q~

And on his farm he had a cow, E-I-E-I-O

T T T~ | Q Q Q~ | T T T~ | Q Q Q~

With a moo-moo here, and a moo-moo there

Q Q Q | T T T~ | T Y T R Q~

Old MacDonald had a farm, E-I-E-I-O

7. üåâ London Bridge is Falling Down

Q W Q R | T Y T~ | T Y T R | W E W~

London Bridge is falling down, falling down, falling down

Q W Q R | T Y T~ | T R W E Q~

London Bridge is falling down, my fair lady

8. üö£ Row Row Row Your Boat

Q Q Q~ | W W W~ | E R T~ | T R E W Q~

Row, row, row your boat, gently down the stream

T T T~ | Y Y Y~ | U I O~ | O I U Y T~

Merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily, life is but a dream

9. üï∑Ô∏è Itsy Bitsy Spider

Q R T | Q R T | T~ T T~ | R R R~

The itsy bitsy spider climbed up the water spout

T Y U | T Y U | U~ U U~ | Y Y Y~

Down came the rain and washed the spider out

I I Y T | R W Q~

Out came the sun

T Y U | T Y U | U~ U U~ | Y Y Y~

And dried up all the rain

Q R T | Q R T | T~

And the itsy bitsy spider climbed up again

10. üöå Wheels on the Bus

Q Q Q | W W W~ | E R T~ | T R E W Q~

The wheels on the bus go round and round, round and round

Q Q Q | W W W~ | E R T~ | T R E W Q~

Round and round, the wheels on the bus go round and round

Q Q Q | W W W~ | E R T~ | T R E W Q~

All through the town
